name: AWSCLI
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool to manage your AWS services. With just one tool to download and configure, you can control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts. You must have the AWS CLI installed to use this task. See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/installing.html for more details.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies he credentials (a service endpoint type of 'AWS') for the task to use when it executes on a build host. New credentials can be created using the Services tab for your project.

If not supplied calls to AWS services made from the task will attempt to obtain credentials to be used in the following order:

* using Team Services variables associated with the build or release
* standard AWS environment variables in the build host's environment
* (if the build host is an EC2 instance) from an instance profile associated with the EC2 instance in its instance metadata.

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: AWS Region
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The AWS region code (us-east-1, us-west-2 etc) of the region containing the AWS resource(s) the task will use or create. For more information see [AWS Regions and Endpoints](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html). If not specified the task will attempt to obtain the region using the following order:

* from a Team Services variable associated with the build or release
* from the standard AWS_REGION environment variable in the build host environment
* (if the build host is an EC2 instance) from instance metadata associated with the EC2 instance.

inputs.name: awsCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsSubCommand
inputs.label: Subcommand
inputs.helpMarkDown: The AWS CLI command to run. Run `aws help` to get complete list of commands or refer to: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/command-structure.html.

inputs.name: awsArguments
inputs.label: Options and parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: The arguments to pass to the AWS CLI command. Run `aws <command> --help` to get complete list of arguments supported by the command.

inputs.name: failOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

messages.AWSCLINotInstalled: AWS CLI is not installed on this machine.
